result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobbie White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victim's family.
Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample unless previously done, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Attempt Robbery with Use of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobbie White

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (31 pages) commencing 09/30/2015 received and filed.  CH

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE WATTS.....
Defendant Bobbie White in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Bobbie White in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by the victim's sister, Doris Taylor, and the victim's cousin, Brittany M.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7-1/2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2-1/2 YEARS.
Credit given for  ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1, AMENDED):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim's family.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Clerk CANCELED the 10-26-2015 at 9:00 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Watts' Court.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Defendant's Letter of Apology.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE WATTS.....
Defendant Bobbie White in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Bobbie White in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to:  Attempt Robbery (Use of Force) as a Party to a Crime [a Class E FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.32(1)(a), 939.50(3)(e), 939.32, 939.05.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE WATTS.....
Defendant Bobbie White in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Bobbie White in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

An Amended Information was filed today by ADA Sara Lewis.
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

filed by ADA Sara Lewis on behalf of the State.  Count 1 is AMENDED to:  Attempt Robbery (Use of Force) as a Party to a Crime [a Class E FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.32(1)(a), 939.50(3)(e), 939.32, 939.05.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Bobbie White not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant's appearance is waived for todays proceedings. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 9/30/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 10/26/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Bobbie White not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Request for substitution made by defense counsel.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, Branch 6.  Defendant is advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case, pursuant to current court rules, to  Judge J.D. Watts Branch 15.  Case adjourned to Branch 15 for scheduling conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Brostrom.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive, case is adjourned to 8-4-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for status to address substitution in Branch 6.

Defendant Bobbie White in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Bobbie White in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Graham-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact/NO FIREARMS Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SHAQUILLE S., DORIS T., QUNNITA S., ANGELA J., RODTRELL C., IVORY W., FAMILY OF MICHAEL T. AND CO-ACTOR:  ANTWON JONES.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Bobbie White

Prior: 120 W. Chambers Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Bobbie White in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Bobbie White in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
